article.headline: FIU 73, South Alabama 62
article.story: MIAMI -- Marvin Roberts scored 18 points to lead Florida International to a 73-62 victory over South Alabama on Saturday night. The Golden Panthers (8-7, 3-0 Sun Belt Conference) built a double-digit lead midway through the first half and maintained it until late in the second half. Augustine Rubit's 3-point play with 3:06 remaining pulled the Jaguars within nine, 67-58. The Panthers responded with two free throws from Phil Gary and Jeremy Allen's field goal, stopping a possible South Alabama comeback. Alex Legion scored 15 points and Allen finished with 13 points as Florida International snapped a six-game losing streak against the Jaguars. The Panthers last defeated South Alabama 69-67 on Feb. 18, 2007. Martino Brock scored 22 points to lead South Alabama (7-8, 1-3). Rubit finished with 20 points and 12 rebounds.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
